page.title: 04BUILDINGS IN LOWICK
page.content: Mainly stonebuilt cottages. The stone is local ironstone and limestone. Very few houses have been built this century and those that have are of similar material. There are a few brickbuilt houses. Roofs are mainly thatch or slate. Some pantiles and hung tiles are evident. There are some terraced cottages which have been converted to make spacious homes though most cottages are detached. A farm stands within the village and its buildings include a milking parlour, Dutch barn, cowsheds and machinery shed.
